summary: Completed comprehensive testing of Consumer Protection Legal Chatbot. Frontend UI is well-designed and functional, but core chat functionality is broken due to Gemini API free tier quota limits (2 requests/minute). Backend architecture is sound but needs API quota upgrade and better error handling.

critical_bugs.issue: Gemini API quota exceeded - free tier limited to 2 requests/minute
critical_bugs.impact: Complete chat functionality failure - users cannot get AI responses
critical_bugs.error_details: 429 Rate Limit Error: quota exceeded for generativelanguage.googleapis.com/generate_content_free_tier_requests

performance_issues.issue: Slow response times causing timeouts in automated tests
performance_issues.impact: Poor user experience with delayed chat history loading

ui_bugs.issue: Contains 'Made with Emergent' text in bottom right corner
ui_bugs.impact: Violates requirement to not mention 'Emergent' anywhere
ui_bugs.location: Bottom right corner of the page

integration_issues.issue: Frontend shows 500 errors when backend API quota is exceeded
integration_issues.impact: No user-friendly error messages for API limitations

passed_tests: Welcome screen loads with clean, modern design
Example questions are clickable and populate input field
UI uses modern fonts (Inter) and clean styling
Backend API endpoints are structurally correct
MongoDB integration working for data persistence

success_percentage.backend: 40% - Core API structure works but quota limits break functionality
success_percentage.frontend: 70% - UI/UX excellent but integration fails due to backend issues

action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Upgrade Gemini API key from free tier to paid tier to remove 2 requests/minute quota limit. Current API key only allows 2 requests per minute which makes the chatbot unusable. Also remove 'Made with Emergent' branding from the page footer.
